blog.name: nightqueendany
blog.title: The Daenerys Defense
blog.description: Hi, I'm Lauren. I'm a Santa Cruzian. Yes as in Banana Slugs. Yes, as in the tee-shirt John Travolta wears in Pulp Fiction. I'm a GOT fan. Daenerys stan. I try to be diplomatic but sometimes swear words come out. Deal with it.  Sideblog for asks: asknightqueendany.tumblr.com

summary: Why Jon may reject his Starkness (at least a little bit) once he finds out the truth about his parentage: I’ve seen lots of...
body:
Why Jon may reject his Starkness (at least a little bit) once he finds out the truth about his parentage:

I’ve seen lots of different posts about this from shippers and non-shippers alike, everyone giving a different take on what Jon will think and feel once Bran and Sam tell him about Lyanna and Rhaegar. So here’s my take. 

Jon has always operated under the assumption that he is Ned Stark’s son. He idolizes Ned, he wants to emulate Ned, thinks of Ned as honest, honorable, best man there is. 

And yet…

Ned lied to Jon his entire life. 

Now, I know, and Jon will know, yes, obviously it was to protect him from Robert and anyone else who had it in for the Targaryens. And when Jon was younger, that’s certainly true and a valid reason for Ned not to tell Jon the truth. 

But not so when Jon is grown and getting ready to join the Night’s Watch.

Jon could see Ned not telling him before they departed Winterfell as Ned not trusting Jon enough with the truth. Really, what did Ned think Jon would do? He had raised this boy to be honorable and to be a good man. Did Ned believe Jon would act a fool and go after Robert to avenge a man he never knew? Did he think Jon would be so arrogant as to actually press his claim against Robert to be King? 

Yes Ned’s silence led Jon to learning about the army of the dead and needing to defeat the Night King and all of that but it also led Jon to his eventual death. 

If Jon hadn’t gone on believing he was Ned Stark’s bastard, he wouldn’t have felt he needed to join the Watch in the first place. Because after all, Jon only joined because he was never going to inherit land or anything and he didn’t want to have children named Snow. He could have stayed back at Winterfell and served Robb, pending Catelyn was told as well. And the Catelyn situation too. Jon was looked down upon his whole life and treated horribly by this woman who was mother to his siblings growing up. If she only would have known the truth that her husband didn’t cheat on her, Jon could have grown up with a wonderful mother figure to look after him. He could have gone to Essos in search of Daenerys and Viserys. He could have gone to King’s Landing to serve as Ned and Arya and Sansa’s protector. His possibilities could have been endless.

Jon could have had so many options and choices but Ned took all of that away from him by not telling him the truth. And I think there’s a fair chance Jon might resent Ned for this.

And with Arya and Sansa’s last scene being about missing Ned, their father’s memory bringing them together, it may even cause a rift between Jon and Arya and Sansa. Arya and Sansa would likely be of the belief that Ned did the right thing in not telling Jon and that he did it to protect him. Which is fair. But if Jon disagrees with them and blames Ned in any way for the things that happened to him after joining the Night’s Watch, how he was treated growing up, the “siblings” may be even be at odds for a while. Isn’t it just like Jon to be broody and push people away? 

Of course, I don’t expect a potential rift between the Stark siblings to last for long if it does come to that. But I believe Ned’s lying to Jon and not trusting him with the truth once he was grown, may push Jon away from wanting to be a Stark. I’m not saying this would make him more accepting of his being a Targaryen either. He will probably be angry about that as well, at least for a while. But once the truth is out, I think there’s a fair chance Ned’s image will be at least cracked, if not completely shattered in Jon’s eyes.

summary: Sent To Me - toaquiprashippar - Game of Thrones (TV) [Archive of Our Own]
title: Sent To Me - toaquiprashippar - Game of Thrones (TV) [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Chapters: 1/1
Fandom: Game of Thrones (TV), A Song of Ice and Fire - George R. R. Martin, A Song of Ice and Fire & Related Fandoms
Rating: Mature
Warnings: Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings
Relationships: Jon Snow/Daenerys Targaryen, Lyanna Stark/Rhaegar Targaryen
Characters: Daenerys Targaryen, Rhaegar Targaryen, Jon Snow, Ned Stark, Robb Stark, Arya Stark, Sansa Stark, Rickon Stark, Catelyn Tully Stark, Arthur Dayne, Oswell Whent
Additional Tags: I’ll give you more character tags if I continue this, Canon Divergence - Robert’s Rebellion, What Could Have Been, Rhaegar Lives, R plus L equals J, Alternate Universe - Canon Divergence
Summary:

He found a reason to live before he could let death claim him.
What he did not know was of the other reasons that could be found across the Narrow Sea.

So, this one was born as a one chapter gift to my bae @fairytalelovr and apparently is to become a multichapter now LOL 
Just a little Jonerys/Rhaegar lives/Alternative Universe - Canon Divergence/ R+L=J thingy for you guys :) 
beta’d by the beautiful @tomakeitbeautifultolive as always <3

title: Jonerys Vampire AU: Part 68
body:
Part 68: #jonerysvampire Jon and Dany grow closer and take a moment for themselves. ⚠️ WARNING: This update contains adult situations, read at your own discretion ♥️⚠️🔥 #jonerys

HUGE THANK YOU to my amazing readers who thanked me today in the sweetest post. Such a nice surprise, and it means the world to me!  @daenerys1417 @drakhus @tomakeitbeautifultolive @starkgaryen4life  ♥️  ♥️  ♥️ And what a COOL blog @joneryslovenotes is!
body_abstract:
